channel.title: Publishing and Sharing on Tools for Academic Research
channel.description: Recent content in Publishing and Sharing on Tools for Academic Research

item.title: Antidote
item.description: Writing assistant with grammar, typography and style check, dictionaries, and writing guides.

item.title: Biorender
item.description: a powerful tool to draw scientific illustrations

item.title: Responsible Journals
item.description: Understand how the journals deal with submissions and how reviews are done

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: note-taking with zettelkasten method (linked notes)

item.title: RoamResearch
item.description: Online note-taking with zettelkasten method (connected notes)

item.title: Notion
item.description: Write, plan, collaborate, and get organized â€” all in one tool. Write connected notes with rich format and Export to markdown, pdf, etc.

item.title: Sci-Hub - Academic Papers for All
item.description: sh can helping people getting academic papers for free

item.title: Whimsical
item.description: Visual workspace, online tool for quick diagrams

item.title: Mathcha
item.description: Online WYSIWYG Formula Editor . Fast and powerful Editing features, inputting Normal text, Math symbols, and drawing Graph.

item.title: Detexify
item.description: Anyone who works with LaTeX knows how time-consuming it can be to find a symbol in symbols-a4.pdf that you just can’t memorize. Detexify is an attempt to simplify this search.

item.title: Undraw
item.description: Open source illustrations

item.title: Unsplash
item.description: Free high resolution images.

item.title: Academicons
item.description: ICONs for academia

item.title: Asciinema
item.description: Command line recording and sharing.

item.title: Bashplotlib
item.description: plotting in the terminal using plaintext

item.title: Scholarpedia
item.description: the peer-reviewed open-access encyclopedia, where knowledge is curated by communities of experts.

item.title: Colorcet
item.description: Colorcet is a collection of perceptually uniform colormaps for use with Python plotting programs like bokeh, matplotlib, holoviews, and datashader based on the set of perceptually uniform colormaps created by Peter Kovesi at the Center for Exploration Targeting.

item.title: Zenodo
item.description: Make anything citable by publishing on Zenodo and getting a DOI code.

item.title: itermplot
item.description: An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal.

item.title: plotnine
item.description: Python visualization package that follows the grammar of graphics.

item.title: Seaborn
item.description: statistical data visualization in Python

item.title: D3.js
item.description: The most widely used javascript lib for visualizations in the browser.

item.title: Zotero
item.description: An open source bibliography reference manager with syncing and BibTeX support.

item.title: Mendeley
item.description: A bibliography reference manager with cloud storage and BibTeX support.

item.title: Readcube/Papers
item.description: A all platform app for reference mamagement, note-taking, and more. The former Papers has been rebanded as ReadCube Papers.

item.title: OSF: Open Science Framework
item.description: OSF is a free, open platform to support your research and enable collaboration.

item.title: ORCID
item.description: A unique ID for researchers

item.title: Duecredit
item.description: duecredit is being conceived to address the problem of inadequate citation of scientific software and methods, and limited visibility of donation requests for open-source software.

item.title: Protocols Io
item.description: Create, share, and collaborate on protocals. Protocals.io is not only for biologist, it can be used for any protocals.

item.title: Self-Plagiarism
item.description: The reuse of significant, identical, or nearly identical portions of one’s own work without acknowledging that one is doing so or citing the original work is sometimes described as self-plagiarism.

item.title: Gimp
item.description: Create and edit images

item.title: Inkscape
item.description: Create SVG graphs

item.title: Gliffy
item.description: Diagram software that works as hard as your team.

item.title: Processon
item.description: Online Mindmap, FlowChart, MindMap, UI, UML and Network charts with Collabration in Real-time.

item.title: Overleaf/Overleaf
item.description: Overleaf and ShareLaTeX are Online LaTeX editors with collaborations, history, chat, and submission.

item.title: Papeeria
item.description: Online LaTeX editor

item.title: Authorea
item.description: Write and submit your papers online.

item.title: Github Pages
item.description: Hosted directly from your GitHub repository. Just edit, push, and your changes are live. Integrated with Jekyll and turns markdown posts automatically. Jekyll is a tool for blogging.

item.title: Read the Docs
item.description: Read the Docs simplifies software documentation by automating building, versioning, and hosting of your docs for you.

item.title: De-Jargonizer
item.description: The De-Jargonizer is an automated jargon identification program aimed at helping scientists and science communication trainers improve and adapt vocabulary use for a variety of audiences.

item.title: Proselint
item.description: Proselint is a linter for English prose.

item.title: Rousseau
item.description: Lightweight proofreader in JS

item.title: Write Good
item.description: Naive linter for English prose

item.title: Visual Studio Code
item.description: Universal editor with an extension marketplace.

item.title: Hemingway App
item.description: Hemingway App makes your writing bold and clear. It highlights complex sentences, point out passive voice, and suggests alternative words.

item.title: Gitbook
item.description: Online tool for personal and team knowledge management.

item.title: Sphinx
item.description: Sphinx is a tool for python code documentation generation. It is also a very good tool to take digital notes since it supports images, equations, tables, code blocks, etc.

item.title: Color Calculator
item.description: Generate color palettes based on harnomy

item.title: ColorBrewer
item.description: Color palete advice for maps

item.title: Paletton
item.description: Generate color palettes

item.title: IQSS: The Institute for Quantitative Social Science
item.description: The Institute for Quantitative Social Science

item.title: ICPSR: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research
item.description: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

item.title: OpenEI
item.description: Linked energy information on hundreds of topics crowdsourced from industry and government agencies.

item.title: Archaeology Data Service
item.description: Certified repository for Archaeology data

item.title: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes
item.description: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes

item.title: new MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes
item.description: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes

item.title: USVAO: US Virtual Astronomical Observatory
item.description: US Virtual Astronomical Observatory

item.title: GEOSS Portal
item.description: Earth science data

item.title: NCEI
item.description: Weather, climate, coasts, oceans, and geophysics etc

item.title: Genbank
item.description: Genetic sequence database

item.title: Figshare
item.description: Figshare allows us store, share and discover research data and other materials.

item.title: Dryad
item.description: The Dryad Digital Repository stores curated data.

item.title: Wolfram Alpha
item.description: Wolfram Alpha is an AI assistant that does data analysis in a smart way.

item.title: Geogebra
item.description: Geogebra is the classical. GeoGebra can be used for precise charting as well as simple calculations.

item.title: Desmos
item.description: Desmos is a simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Graph.tk
item.description: Graph.tk is a dead simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Plotly
item.description: Plotly is a set of open-source graphing libraries. Plotly is the goto library to make interactive charts in Python, R, or JavaScript.

item.title: Mathematica Online
item.description: The online version of Mathematica!

item.title: Cocalc
item.description: A toolkit for coding and writing online. The UI is a bit outdated but the services are real hardcore.

item.title: Azure Notebooks
item.description: Azure notebooks is simply a hosted Jupyter notebook.

item.title: Kaggle
item.description: Kaggle is a competition platform that bundles online computing Jupyter notebooks and data management.

item.title: Next Journal
item.description: NextJournal is the notebook for reproducible research. NextJournal provides poly-language notebooks and beautiful UI.

item.title: Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is an online version of Jupyter Notebook which allows us to use free computation powers from Google and storage on Google Drive. Google Colab also comes with free GPU hours.
